title: Utvecklare Kundservice
description:
**Ansök nu**

**Om tjänsten:**



Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens kundservice inom en av Sveriges mest spännande dagligvaruaktörer? Du får en nyckelroll i att förbättra kundservice arbetssätt och processer – alltid med kunden i fokus.  

Som **Kundserviceutvecklare** på Coop identifierar du utvecklingsmöjligheter, tar fram lösningsförslag och leder arbetet från idé till implementering. Det kan handla om förändrade rutiner, automatisering, selfservice eller anpassningar av systemstöd.



Vi söker dig som har ett hjärta för service, ett öga för förbättring och ett driv att leda utveckling framåt. Vi tror att du har hunnit samla på dig viss erfarenhet, men att du fortfarande är nyfiken, vill utvecklas och formas i rollen. Du har grunderna för att kunna projektleda, dokumentera och arbeta strukturerat.  



**Som Kundserviceutvecklare kommer du att arbeta med att:**


* Identifiera förbättringsområden i kundserviceprocesser och driva utvecklingsinitiativ
* Leda och stötta implementation av nya eller förändrade system, verktyg och arbetssätt (t.ex. chattbotar, självservice-lösningar)
* Analysera kundfeedback, statistik och ärendedata för att skapa insikter och beslutsunderlag
* Utveckla och dokumentera nya rutiner och processer samt stötta kundserviceteamet genom utbildningsinsatser
* Säkerställa att kundservicearbetet efterlever aktuella lagar, regelverk och interna riskbedömningar
* Arbeta med prognoser och resursplanering

  
**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


**Vem är du?**



Vi söker dig som drivs av kundorientering, förbättringsarbete och innovation. Du är noggrann, van att ta ansvar och har ett lösningsfokuserat tänk. Du har erfarenhet från kundservice i en operativ, taktisk eller utvecklande roll och trivs med att jobba tvärfunktionellt i förändringsprojekt.


Du är analytisk, strukturerad och engagerad – och gillar att förbättra, förenkla och skapa värde. Du har också förmågan att omsätta insikter till konkreta resultat


**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:**


* Erfarenhet av utveckling inom kundservice, t.ex. processer, system eller digitala lösningar
* Förmåga att analysera data och kundinsikter för att driva förbättringar
* Vana att arbeta i projektform och gärna i nära samarbete med IT eller digitala team
* Erfarenhet av kundserviceverktyg som CRM- eller ärendehanteringssystem
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område, eller motsvarande erfarenhet  

  

**Meriterande:** Erfarenhet av automatisering, chatbot, self-service-portaler eller sömlös kundinteraktion i de kanaler vi kommunicerar med våra kunder

**Personliga egenskaper som vi värdesätter:**


* Engagerad och kommunikativ


* Lösningsorienterad med stark initiativförmåga


* Självständig men samarbetsvillig


* Strukturerad och nyfiken


**Vårt erbjudande till dig:**



Vi erbjuder dig en roll med stor påverkansmöjlighet där du får vara med och skapa framtidens kundupplevelse. Du blir en del av ett team med stort engagemang och gemensam riktning – och en arbetsgivare med ett tydligt hållbarhetsfokus. Vi erbjuder även konkurrenskraftiga förmåner, kollektivavtal, flexibel arbetstid och god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Tjänsten är placerad på vårt huvudkontor i Solna, och vissa resor kan förekomma.


**Så ansöker du:**



Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan senast **17 maj 2025**, då vi arbetar med löpande urval och intervjuer.



För att rättvist matcha kandidater med de krav som rollen ställer kommer vi att använda tester i urvalsprocessen.



Har du frågor om tjänsten? Välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef **Chris Öhman.**

title: .Net Developer
description:
**Assignment:** Senior .NET Developers (2 Consultants Needed)
  
We are currently looking for two experienced .NET developers to join a product team focused on installed applications. The role involves both modernizing existing apps and contributing to the next-generation cross-platform solution.
  
  

**Primary Responsibilities:**  

Collaborate with the team to develop and refine a suite of applications while following best practices and internal guidelines
  
Support the transition from legacy technologies like Xamarin/Electron to MAUI for a unified cross-platform experience
  
Apply sound architectural principles, utilize established design patterns, and work with system interfaces and dependencies
  
Contribute to sprint planning, prioritization, and ongoing improvement of development workflows
  
Maintain high standards of quality, security, performance, and scalability in all deliveries
  
  

**Required Experience:**  

Demonstrated track record in developing and supporting installable applications for desktop (Windows, Mac) and mobile (iOS, Android)
  
Hands-on experience with .NET-based cross-platform technologies, particularly Xamarin and MAUI; experience with Electron is a plus
  
Familiarity with software quality assurance methods and testing principles
  
Analytical and detail-oriented mindset with the ability to write clean, maintainable code
  
  

**Educational Background:**  

A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field (Bachelor’s or Master’s level)
  
Minimum of 3 years professional experience in .NET development
  
  

**Additional Information:**  

Immediate start preferred
  
**Tech Stack:** .NET, Xamarin, MAUI, Electron, Android, iOS, Windows
  
  

About Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Utvecklare till Aircraft Simulation
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll.*


Din roll


Vår sektion, Aircraft Simulation, växer och nu söker vi efter fler seniora mjukvaruutvecklare som är sugna på att både vidareutveckla våra mjukvarukomponenter men även sig själva inom flertal olika aspekter såsom teknik, mjukvaruutveckling och teamwork. Vårt team värderar samarbete högt och du kommer arbeta med många andra människor utanför vår sektion, som tillsammans utvecklar såväl Gripen som dess simulatorer.


I den här rollen kommer du att ingå i ett av våra tre team. Teamen har olika fokusområden men alla jobbar med utveckling av vår komplexa produkt utifrån olika perspektiv. Vi har stort fokus på att kunna leverera vår mjukvara med rätt innehåll och bra kvalitet. Vardagen hos kan bestå av många varierande uppgifter beroende var i utvecklingsskedet vi befinner oss i. Allt ifrån kodning av nya funktioner, integration av mjukvaran med övriga komponenter, felsökning till testning och leveranser med tillhörande dokumentation.


Vi strävar efter ständig förbättring och lärande och därför har vi en Learning & Innovation Day där man ges möjlighet att lära av varandra men även få tid för att testa nya saker eller förkovra sig i ny teknik eller språk. Du blir en del av ett härligt gäng som besitter olika erfarenheter där vi gärna hjälper varandra med både högt och lågt samt sätter laget framför jaget.


Sektionen Aircraft Simulation är en del av områden Utvecklingssimulatorer som ansvarar för att utveckla och leverera en realistisk simulering av JAS 39 Gripen, som skall användas både för utveckling av flygplanet men även för träning av piloter och tekniker.


Din profil


Vi söker dig som gillar att skriva kod, utveckla funktioner och utföra felsökning samt har jobbat med flera olika programmeringsspråk. De språk vi använder mest är ADA, C, C++ och Pyton, men även Fortran kan förekomma. Du är bekväm med verktyg från Atlassian sviten (Jira, Bitbucket och Confluence). Vidare så har du flera års erfarenhet av att utveckla mindre och mer komplex mjukvara. Du har en relevant akademisk examen eller arbetslivserfarenhet som kan ses som likvärdig. Därtill är det meriterande om du arbetat efter agila principer.


För att passa i rollen bör du ha en god analytisk förmåga samt kan identifiera samband och behov. Som person är du ansvarstagande och bekväm med att ta egna initiativ för att driva ditt arbete framåt. Då du kommer tillhöra ett tekniskt team är det viktigt att vara en lagspelare med förmågan att samarbeta med andra. Därtill är det också värdefullt om du kan bidra med nya idéer och sprida din expertis till andra.


Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.


Vad du blir en del av


Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.


Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25,500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.


*Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut. Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!*
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Fullstack Developer to MittVaccin
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1100 employees in several countries.*
*Since 2012, MittVaccin has been a pioneer in digital service development for residents and healthcare providers within both the private and public healthcare sectors. Since 2020, we are Cambio MittVaccin, and as a member of Cambio, our innovation and digitalization of vaccination services have accelerated. With the trust of 13 regions and 350 healthcare providers with clinics in over 220 municipalities in Sweden's all 21 regions, we have a nationwide presence, continuously striving to improve the interaction between vaccinators and residents. MittVaccin is the singlest largest source of vaccination information in Sweden supporting not only its many healthcare providers but also national reporting and information sharing. Our work increases awareness, knowledge, and accessibility to vaccinations. In this way, we aim to drive demand for patient-safe and efficient vaccination management in Sweden, ultimately benefiting both public health and society’s protection against serious diseases* 
*.*
**The position**
 As a Fullstack Developer with us, you will have the opportunity to work on and develop Sweden's most modern and well-established digital vaccination platform – MittVaccin; both the EHR system and the Inhabitant service mittvaccin.se and related solution components. You will be part of a dynamic and agile organization with global ambitions. Every team member is an essential link in the chain, and each person has significant individual responsibility and the opportunity to shape their role. You will see firsthand how your development work contributes to public benefit and preventive healthcare for all.
   

  

 In this role, you will work on the development, design, and architecture of both our frontend and backend, with a primary focus on backend. You will also be involved in technical investigations as part of your work. Together with the development team—comprising system developers, solution architects, product owners, and others—you will drive the development of MittVaccin Journal and MittVaccin Citizen Service forward.
   

  

 The focus is on new development and building from scratch rather than pure maintenance. Key requirements for the services include scalability, performance, regulatory compliance, medical safety, and self-service functionality. The development team works agilely using Kanban and Scrum in sprints, with multiple service releases each year. You will participate in sprint planning alongside product owners and the rest of the development team.
   

  

 Our workplace is characterized by modern and coaching leadership, respect, inclusion, transparency, personal ownership, flexibility, continuous improvement, and a strong commitment to caring for each other as colleagues and human beings.
   

  

 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 You are passionate about finding the best solutions for our customers, have a pedagogical approach, and find it interesting to deepen your understanding of various healthcare processes and needs—translating them into technical solutions. You work independently with strong self-motivation but also thrive when collaborating with your team members or customers.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* 5+ years of experience as a full-stack developer
* Strong proficiency in SQL (including stored programs, views, and performance optimization)
* Extensive knowledge of PHP and PHPUnit, including object-oriented frameworks
* Experience with JavaScript and React or similar libraries
* Knowledge of API design and development
* Experience in requirements gathering, architecture/design, and development infrastructure
* Solid experience working with agile methodologies, such as Scrum and Kanban
* Experience working with IT/development in swedish healthcare, providing an understanding of relevant laws and regulations affecting system design
* Ability to communicate fluently in Swedish, as it is required for daily communication.


**It's a bonus if you have**
* Experience with some of the following: MySQL, Apache, Redis, Docker or Git
* Experience with clustered environments and load balancing for web applications
* Experience with API technologies such as SOAP and REST
* Experience using standards and reference models for healthcare informatics and interoperability, such as FHIR, OpenEHR, Snomed-CT, ICD, KVÅ, and related regulatory frameworks for information management
* Experience working with IT/development in healthcare, giving you an understanding of the laws and regulations that impact system design


**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in
 **Sweden.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Java)
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***
**Who We Are…**
 When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the
 *storytellers* 
 bringing our characters to life, the
 *creators* 
 bringing them to your living rooms and the
 *dreamers* 
 creating what’s next…
   

  

 From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
   

  

 Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team.
   

  

**Your New Role...**
 The Direct-to-Consumer Group is a technology company within Warner Bros. Discovery. We are building a global streaming video platform (OTT), and a suite of applications to support all our network’s brands globally. We are building modern container-based micro- services operated on AWS. We build user experiences ranging from classic lean-back viewing to interactive learning applications. We build for connected TVs, web, mobile phones, tablets, and consoles for a large footprint of WBD-owned networks and products worldwide. We are looking for a Senior Engineer to join our engineering team in Sweden.
   

  

**Your Role Accountabilities...**
* You can work autonomously to design and develop functional changes to
* existing software systems. You require little or no guidance from team members. You still actively seek input where appropriate and engage your team to inform and share what you are doing.
* You can collaborate with other engineers and assist with features another engineer designed or take the lead on feature design yourself. Your software contributions are demonstrated to work in production, and your team trusts your decisions, designs, and code.
* You show good judgement in making trade-offs between immediate and long-term business needs.
* You can describe and defend your design and code decisions to other engineers, embrace constructive feedback, and adapt your approach to align with team and company standards and objectives.
* You consistently demonstrated good software ownership practices (e.g. code reviews, code comments, etc.) in all of your contributions. Your code reviews are uneventful, you prepare documentation proactively, and you ensure proper monitoring for operational
* excellence in production.
* You offer enhancements to best practices, document, design, and architecture
* improvements, and as feedback through code reviews to other engineers without continuous prompting or recurring encouragement. Other engineers appreciate your feedback.
* You can troubleshoot a production issue by reviewing source code, logs, operational metrics, stack trace, etc. to pinpoint a specific problem and then resolve it.


**Qualifications And Experience...**
* 5-7 years of experience within Software Development and proficient in Java 17 or other JVM languages.
* Deep understanding of Docker, Kubernetes, Minikube and AWS.
* Good understanding of CI/CD tools like Jenkins and Github Action.
* Good working understanding of asynchronous messaging frameworks like Kafka.
* Great understanding of distributed systems challenges, micro-service-based
* architectures and asynchronized communication
* Experience and good understanding of implementing alerting, metrics, and logging using tools like Prometheus, CloudWatch, Datadog, Splunk, Kibana, PagerDuty.
* Practical knowledge of contract first development model and ability to design
* API contracts before starting development.
* Practical knowledge of persistence and caching solutions such as Mysql, PostgreSQL, Redis, ElasticSearch, Caffeine.
* Good understanding of database modelling and fine-tuning database queries for optimal performance.
* Good understanding of asynchronous, non-blocking, functional/reactive style of programming. Hands-on experience with frameworks such as Spring WebFlux, Vert.x


**How We Get Things Done…**
 This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
   

  

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**
 Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.
   

  

 If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our accessibility page for instructions to submit your request.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
**About Applied Intuition**
 Applied Intuition is a vehicle software supplier that accelerates the adoption of safe and intelligent machines worldwide. Founded in 2017, Applied Intuition delivers the AI-powered ADAS/AD toolchain, Vehicle OS, and autonomy stack to help customers shorten time to market, build high-quality systems, and create next-generation consumer experiences. 18 of the top 20 global automakers trust Applied Intuition’s solutions to drive the production of modern vehicles. Applied Intuition serves the automotive, trucking, construction, mining, agriculture, and defense industries and is headquartered in Mountain View, CA, with offices in San Diego, CA, Ft. Walton Beach, FL, Ann Arbor and Detroit, MI, Washington, D.C., Stuttgart, Munich, Stockholm, Seoul, and Tokyo. Learn more at appliedintuition.com.
   

  

*We are an in-office company, and our expectation is that employees primarily work from their Applied Intuition office 5 days a week. However, we also recognize the importance of flexibility and trust our employees to manage their schedules responsibly. This may include occasional remote work, starting the day with morning meetings from home before heading to the office, or leaving earlier when needed to accommodate family commitments.* 
 (Note: this is not applicable for EpiSci roles).
   

  

**Meet our engineers on the Vehicle OS team!**
 Vehicle OS is a flexible suite of products that help vehicle manufacturers develop, deploy, and update complete vehicle software and AI applications. Learn more about what the team is building, the team culture, and why it’s one of the most exciting projects at Applied Intuition.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Applied Intuition is looking for senior software engineers with expertise in developing embedded software applications on production computers to help in developing our newest product. It is a unique opportunity to work on challenging engineering problems while being part of a fast-moving team.
   

  

 At Applied Intuition, you will
   

  

* Architect and develop highly-reliable embedded software
* Integrate different components from vendors in a common software framework, and ensure that the low-level communication (eg. CAN) is done correctly
* Implement suitable real-time operating system applications as needed for the product
* Work closely with hardware engineers to bring up the complete system and validate the functionality


 We're looking for someone who has
   

  

* 3+ years of experience working on embedded devices
* Experience with RTOS and middleware applications
* Excellent C or C++ programming skills
* Ability to do low-level debugging on hardware to ensure complete system operation


 Nice to have
   

  

* Prior experience in developing on-vehicle technology
* Ability to work with safety critical robotic systems with real time constraints
* Previous startup experience


**Benefits and** 
**perks**
* Lunch and dinner allowance
* Fitness (600 USD) and learning stipends (1,000 USD) annually
* Stock options


*Don’t meet every single requirement? If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.*
*Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.*

title: System Developer
description:
På NOBA är vi i framkant av automatiserade kreditbeslut och använder en flexibel och utbyggbar plattform för att effektivisera kreditbedömningar för våra olika utlåningsprodukter. Gå med i vårt
 **Credit Risk Engine-team** 
 och samarbeta med kreditspecialister och analytiker för att driva innovation inom kreditriskhantering.
   

  

**Om Rollen**
 Som utvecklare av vårt kreditbeslutssystem kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i utvecklingen och förbättringen av vår kreditbeslutsplattform. Du kommer att delta i både dagligt genomförande av förändringar för att hantera kreditrisk och driva försäljning, samt bidra till långsiktiga strategiska mål. Denna position erbjuder en unik möjlighet att fördjupa din förståelse för kreditrisk och automatiserade beslutsystem.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga Uppgifter**
* Utveckla och integrera Python-komponenter i S1.
* Vid behov implementera kreditregler i beslutssystemet StrategyOne (S1) baserat på krav från kreditspecialister.
* Delta i kodgranskningar och förbättra kodkvaliteten.
* Samarbeta med teammedlemmar för att lösa olika tekniska utmaningar kring beslutssystemet.
* Köra och analysera simuleringar för att optimera kreditstrategier.
* Bistå teamet med utredning och åtgärd av problem och buggar i systemen.


**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Utbildning inom kvantitativa ämnen (t.ex. matematik, statistik, datavetenskap eller liknande) krävs.
* Grundläggande SQL-databaskunskaper.
* Talar och skriver svenska obehindrat.
* Kunskap i ett programmeringsspråk: Python föredras, men det är möjligt för rätt person att lära sig på jobbet om de är skickliga i ett annat språk.


**Vi Ser Det Som Positivt Om Du**
* Erfarenhet av dataanalys
* Har 3-5 års erfarenhet av utveckling med Python.
* Förståelse för funktioner och begränsningar i no-code eller low-code system t.ex. StrategyOne, Provenir, Salesforce etc.


**För att trivas och prestera väl i rollen tror vi att du behöver vara:**
 Någon som trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du är en problemlösare som gärna tar dig an utmaningar och är uthållig även när förutsättningarna är oklara.
   

  

 Du är kommunikativ och har förmågan att förklara tekniska koncept på ett tydligt och tillgängligt sätt för olika delar av verksamheten. Din analytiska förmåga hjälper dig att bryta ner krav, förstå syftet bakom dem och dra relevanta slutsatser av resultat och förändringar. Vi ser gärna att du är resultatdriven och har en god känsla för balansen mellan tid, kvalitet och funktion.
   

  

**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
* Jobba inom ett spännande område som ligger i snittet av kreditrisk och systemutveckling. Du jobbar nära användare, löser reella problem och får chansen att se och analysera resultaten.
* Innovativ arbetsmiljö med korta beslutsvägar. Gör riktigt skillnad i ett snabbfotat team som är hett efterfrågat på banken och levererar värde varje dag.
* Möjligheter till professionell tillväxt och utveckling inom bank och finans - kreditrisk.


 Utöver detta är det viktigt för oss att du känner igen dig i våra värderingar: vi är helhjärtade, vi samarbetar och vi tar ledningen.
   

  

**Praktisk Information**
 Plats: Gävlegatan 22, Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning (tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning)
   

  

 Omfattning: Heltid
   

  

 Arbetstider: 08.30-17:00 (jun-aug 08:30-16:00)
   

  

**Har du hört om NOBAVERSE?** 
 I vårt NOBAVERSE värdesätter vi öppenhet, tillit och mångfald. Hos oss får du påverka din utveckling och ha roligt på vägen mot våra mål – allt i en lite extra bubbly miljö! ✨ Läs mer om vårt medarbetarlöfte på vår karriärsida.
   

  

 Vi eftersträvar mångfald av kunskaper och erfarenheter bland våra anställda och välkomnar alla sökande med kvalifikationer för anställningen. Vi värnar om en rekrytering fri från diskriminering som ger lika möjligheter för alla.
   

  

**Vad händer när du har skickat in din ansökan?**
 Antalet steg i rekryteringsprocessen kan variera beroende på vilken tjänst du sökt men vi försöker alltid att hålla processen så kort och koncis som möjligt, för att värna om din ansökningsupplevelse. Du kan läsa mer om hur vår rekryteringsprocess går till under FAQ.
   

  

 Om du har några frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten så kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Rebecca Khan på rebecca.khan@nordax.se.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 🙏✨
   

  

 NOBA bank värnar om din integritet och vill, med hänvisning till GDPR, be dig att inte inkludera några känsliga personuppgifter i din ansökan. Exempel på känsliga personuppgifter kan vara information om etniskt ursprung, politiska åsikter, religiös övertygelse eller information om din hälsa, till exempel sjukskrivning. Har du skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig meddela detta till den rekryteringsansvarig som står angiven nedan så att vi kan hantera dina personuppgifter korrekt.

title: Integration Developer
description:
At
 **Schibsted Media** 
 , our mission is to empower people in the Nordics to make informed decisions through high-quality journalism and innovative digital solutions. Behind the scenes, our Integration Solutions team ensures that systems and services are seamlessly connected, enabling efficient workflows and operations across the organization.
   

  

 We’re now looking for an
 **Integration Developer** 
 with expertise in
 **platform and infrastructure management** 
 to join our
 **Integration Solutions** 
 team. If you're passionate about building scalable integration systems, automating infrastructure, and working in a collaborative, open-minded team—this could be your next exciting challenge.
   

  

 In this role, you will have two main responsibilities - development and infrastructure management. You will be a key member of the development team, as well as collaborate closely with the infrastructure team to manage the platform infrastructure, ensuring seamless system integration and robust infrastructure management. You will ensure that the different components of the integration platform (logging, monitoring, deployment etc) work seamlessly together in a unified manner.
   

  

 🌍 Why this role matters
   

  

 With Schibsted transitioning into two distinct companies—
 **Schibsted Media** 
 and
 **Schibsted Marketplaces** 
 —our Integration Solutions team is playing a key role in building a future-ready integration landscape. We’re establishing a new
 **Integration Competency Center (ICC)** 
 to support this transformation, and you’ll be part of shaping the tools, processes, and infrastructure that support essential business operations across HR, Finance, Payroll, and more.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

 As an Integration Developer focused on platform and infrastructure, you will:
   

  

* ✅ Design, develop, test, and deploy scalable and secure integration solutions.
* ✅ Manage infrastructure components using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform.
* ✅ Drive CI/CD adoption by building tools and automating workflows with GitHub Actions.
* ✅ Monitor and maintain platform performance with proactive incident and environment management.
* ✅ Implement DevOps best practices across multiple environments to ensure efficiency and resilience.
* ✅ Collaborate with both IT and business stakeholders to translate needs into practical, scalable solutions.
* ✅ Work closely with Solution Architects and Integration Architects to continuously evolve our integration platform.
* ✅ Actively contribute to a transparent, agile team environment—sharing responsibilities like the Scrum Master role.


 Who you are
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-moving environment and values honest collaboration. You might be a great match if you:
   

  

* ✅ Are passionate about technology and creating well-functioning, scalable integration solutions.
* ✅ Have a DevOps mindset and enjoy combining development with infrastructure work.
* ✅ A strong communicator who can explain complex technical concepts in simple terms.
* ✅ Are pragmatic, proactive, and always looking for opportunities to improve tools and processes.
* ✅ Enjoy working closely with others and helping build a collaborative team culture.
* ✅ Embrace feedback and continuous learning as part of your daily work.


 What you bring
   

  

 We're looking for a strong mix of technical skills and collaborative mindset. Ideally, you have:
   

  

* 🔧 Hands-on experience designing and implementing integration solutions using tools like MuleSoft, Azure Integration Services, APIs, and event-driven messaging.
* 🔄 Solid understanding of CI/CD principles and the ability to automate deployments with GitHub Actions.
* 🧱 Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools, especially Terraform.
* 🧠 Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for creating maintainable, high-quality solutions.
* 🤝 The ability to work independently while contributing actively to an agile, team-driven environment.


 Why join Schibsted?
   

  

 At Schibsted, we’re more than a media company—we’re a community of bold thinkers, problem solvers, and truth-seekers. We believe that innovation, transparency, and inclusivity are key to supporting independent journalism and trustworthy media.
   

  

 By joining us, you’ll play a key part in transforming the way our teams collaborate and operate. You’ll also have the chance to help shape a brand-new Integration Competency Center that supports our mission and empowers people across our organisation to work smarter and more connected.
   

  

**📩 Ready to make an impact? Apply now and help us build the infrastructure behind Schibsted Media’s future.**

title: Lead Developer
description:
Would you like to contribute to the digital success story at the largest insurance company in the Nordics? If Insurance is leading the way with significant investments in digital channels, and we're looking for a Lead Developer to enhance our webshop solutions towards private customers across our markets.
 



  





 In this role, you'll play a key role in modernizing our digital platforms and maintaining critical applications. If you're passionate about technology, thrive in collaborative teams, and enjoy mentoring colleagues, we'd like you on board.
 



  





**About The Role And Team** 




 As Lead Developer, you’ll join a dedicated chapter responsible for developing and maintaining webshop solutions for private customers across the Nordics. Our applications, primarily built on the .NET platform, require ongoing innovation and careful maintenance. You'll be actively involved in the full software development lifecycle—from analysis and design to deployment and ongoing support—in a team committed to continuous delivery and shared accountability.
 



  





 At If, we strongly embrace agile principles, collaborating closely in cross-functional squads with business experts, ensuring close alignment beyond IT. Our teams focus heavily on customer experience, continuous innovation, and leveraging modern technologies to remain industry leaders.
 



  





**We offer** 




 Just as we have expectations of you, you should have high expectations of us as your employer. Here are some of the benefits we offer at If:
 


* An inclusive workplace where diversity is welcomed and respected.
* Career development opportunities within the largest insurance company in the Nordics.
* Engaging social activities in a professional and highly skilled environment.
* Flexibility through a hybrid working model.
* A health-promoting workplace, including wellness allowances and various sports activities
* Attractive insurance benefits and pension



  





**What you'll do:** 




**Development and Architecture:** 



* Design and implement robust and scalable software solutions.
* Ensure high-quality, maintainable code and stay updated on relevant technologies.
* Advocate for quality assurance practices, automated testing, and continuous delivery.



  





**Technical Leadership:** 



* Guide and mentor a skilled team of developers.
* Collaborate closely with product managers and stakeholders to transform business needs into technical solutions.



  





**Team Collaboration:** 



* Foster a collaborative environment focused on continuous improvement.
* Support team members' professional growth through mentoring.
* Conduct regular code reviews to maintain high standards and best practices.



  





**Who are you?** 



* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields.
* At least 5 years of relevant experience as a Tech Lead or Senior Developer.
* Strong proficiency in C#, .NET, and Azure cloud platforms.
* Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Azure DevOps).
* Proficiency in database design and SQL.
* Experience with front-end development (React).
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
* Experience from e-commerce and digital sales in B2C
* Fluent in Swedish and English



  





**Additional Facts And The Recruitment Process** 




**Application deadline:** 
 April 30, 2024. Please attach your CV with your application.
 



**Work location:** 
 Stockholm, Bergshamra
 



**Start date:** 
 As soon as possible, by agreement
 



 For further information, please contact Zarif Jawad, Chapter Lead, at zarif.jawad@if.se'
 



 We look forward to your application!
 







**About Us** 








***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.***




*To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.* 




*We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.* 




*We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.* 




*Come and join us!*

title: Software Engineer - L3 Support
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a Software Engineer - L3 Support to…
   

  

 …work in a dynamic and exciting engineering role in Linux-based infrastructure and applications, covering all layers of the stack, including bare metal, virtualization (KVM), containerization (Docker/LXC/LXD), storage (Ceph and Linux filesystems), networking (OVS, OVN and Core networking), OpenStack, Kubernetes and the open source applications running on top of them. It will challenge you to show the breadth of your engineering skills, which will be needed to work on almost any aspect of Ubuntu and the open source applications large enterprise customers run.
   

  

 This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and open source to build a career with Canonical and drive success for our customers, community and the company. If you have an affinity for open source software, great communication skills, and a passion for troubleshooting and fixing issues in technology used by millions across the world, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

 This role deals with critical issues in the open source stack that require upstream bug fixes. Our engineers are able to work productively at any level of the stack including the kernel and in a wide range of languages, to understand and address the software issues at hand. Our group is critical to the success of our customers, partners and Ubuntu itself.
   

  

 You will help with troubleshooting and driving issues to resolution with workarounds, guidance, and bug fixes to be released upstream and in Ubuntu.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This is a remote role, we have teams in all time zones.
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Resolve complex customer problems related to Ubuntu, Kernel, Ceph, OpenStack, or Kubernetes and other open source software
* Maintain a close working relationship with Canonical's Field, Support and product engineering teams
* Participate in upstream communities
* Develop bug fixes, backport patches, and work with upstream for inclusion
* Review code produced by other engineers
* Demonstrate good judgment in technical methods and techniques
* Prioritize work and manage your time effectively against those priorities
* Participate in team discussions to improve processes, tools, and documentation
* Maintain clear, technical and concise communications
* Work from home and travel internationally up to 10% of work time for team meetings, events and conferences


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record
* Background in Computer Science, STEM or similar
* Experience with Linux and open source software
* Experience with at least one of Python, Go, C or C++ on Linux
* A drive to learn unfamiliar technology and deep-dive difficult issues
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


 Nice-to-have skills
   

  

* You love technology and working with brilliant people
* You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
* You have interest in, or willingness to learn about any of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, Kubernetes, OpenStack, Ceph, QEMU/KVM, LXC/LXD,Postgresql, Mongo, Debian packaging, distributed systems


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: iOS Developer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for an
 **iOS Developer** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As an iOS developer for Player Experience, you will join Viaplay with the mission to further develop and maintain our platform with a focus on developing and improving our player experience on iOS and tvOS. You are dedicated making sure our customers have a pleasant and smooth experience while playing content from our Viaplay library.
   

  

 You’ll be involved in the whole development lifecycle and everyday work may consist of development, solution design, complexity assessment, as well as test and deployment for the Player Framework, and Viaplay apps & software.
   

  

 You will join our Player Experience team that is distributed in Stockholm and Barcelona, and with your peers, you will be developing solutions aligned with technical and product long-term visions. The team delivers on goals based on our customer journey and are autonomous in how to create the best solutions to reach their goals, but collaboration with other teams is key.
   

  

**Some Responsibilities Within The Role**
* Contribute to the development of features that elevate the overall player experience, including seamless content transitions and advanced playback controls
* Optimize code for performance, responsiveness, and cross-device compatibility to deliver a consistent experience on various platforms
* Implement interactive features and controls within the media player interface, enhancing user engagement during content playback
* Design and implement intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces for media streaming applications
* Work closely with UI/UX designers to bring design concepts to life, ensuring a seamless and engaging player experience
* Collaborate with backend developers to integrate APIs, ensuring smooth communication between the frontend and server-side components
* Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to maintain high code quality standards


**What We’re Looking For**
 We think you have some years of hands-on experience developing iOS/tvOS applications. If you have experience working on streaming and player experience, we would be blown away! We would also like to give you an opportunity to grow and learn , but also to push forward internal development by sharing knowledge and keeping on top of the latest technologies.
   

  

**Role**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* Proven experience as an iOS Developer (mobile and/or tvOS)
* Proficient in Swift and Objective-C
* Understanding of the iOS SDK and Frameworks (AVFoundation for media playback)
* Familiarity with UIKit and SwiftUI
* Experience in designing and implementing user interfaces for media streaming applications or video players.
* Understanding of responsive design principles and the ability to create device-agnostic interfaces that adapt to various screen sizes.
* Collaboration skills to work effectively with other developers, streaming engineers, UI/UX designers and others.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail in optimizing frontend code for performance.


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience in AVPlayer
* Familiarity with other media player frameworks and adaptive streaming technologies
* Knowledge of video encoding/decoding, streaming protocols (e.g., HLS), and video playback optimization
* Knowledge on content protection


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Workday Financials Administrator
description:
For the past 20 years, ProPharma has improved the health and wellness of patients by providing advice and expertise that empowers biotech, med device, and pharmaceutical organizations of all sizes to confidently advance scientific breakthroughs and introduce new therapies. As the world’s largest RCO (Research Consulting Organization), ProPharma partners with its clients through an advise-build-operate model across the complete product lifecycle. With deep domain expertise in regulatory sciences, clinical research solutions, quality & compliance, pharmacovigilance, medical information, and R&D technology, ProPharma offers an end-to-end suite of fully customizable consulting solutions that de-risk and accelerate our partners’ most high-profile drug and device programs.
   

  

**Essential Functions**
* Responsible for providing ongoing technical support and maintenance for the Workday FINS functional areas, including configuration, business processes and related security.
* Owns the responsibility for the Global Service Desk ticket queue for FINS functional tickets. Ensures that tickets are resolved in a timely manner in accordance with applicable SLAs.
* Gather requirements for improvements and new functionalities through collaboration with cross-functional business teams and develop the solution to meet the business needs.
* Evaluate existing functionalities and ensure they continue to meet the needs of the business.
* Monitor existing functionalities and troubleshoot and correct any errors or failures on a timely basis.
* Collaborate with the Workday Integration Developer as the Workday FINS subject matter expert to support any related integrations.
* Create and maintain process documents as needed.
* Serve as the Workday FINS Lead for Workday projects, including optimization, implementation of new features and integrations of future acquisitions.
* Creates and documents test scenarios to validate configuration, executes the test scenarios and/or provides the test scenarios to other teams for testing, provides inputs on FINS considerations and dependencies to the Testing Leads to ensure sufficient FINS testing coverage for acquisition integrations and other major changes to the system (releases, new functionality, etc.).
* Supports the process for review and testing of semi-annual Workday releases and ensures any issues identified in the FINS functional areas are researched and resolved during the release testing window.
* Acts as SME for Kainos SmartTest FINS testing.
* Participate in the Workday Community and other resources, including training and user groups, to establish awareness of current trends, enhancements, releases and system bugs.
* Work closely with IT Service Management and the Workday Product Team to secure optimal uptime, performance, and usage of the product.
* Other duties as assigned.


**Necessary Skills And Abilities**
* Advanced knowledge in Workday FINS functional areas, including but not limited to FDM, Accounting, Customers, Suppliers, Expenses, Banking & Settlement, Business Assets, and Financial Reporting.
* Knowledge of Workday security structure as it relates to the above noted functional areas.
* Comprehension of the interrelationships between the various functional areas within Workday.
* Understanding of tax setup (Sales Tax, GST, VAT, etc.) within Workday a plus.
* Must have a can-do attitude along with an ability to learn new skills.
* Motivated, possesses self-awareness and a demonstrated ability to collaborate with other high-performing team members.
* Outstanding organizational, prioritization, multitasking, and time management skills.
* Ability to work with cross-functional teams to drive projects, gather requirements, provide development estimates, and meet expected delivery timelines.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills needed to work effectively with non-technical functional team members and business owners.
* Ability to adapt to multiple changing business priorities with calm and ease.
* Motivated and have a demonstrated ability to collaborate with other high-performing team members.


**Educational Requirements**
* Bachelor’s degree in information systems, computer science or similar, or equivalent combination of education and work experience.


**Experience Requirements**
* 5+ years of direct experience configuring, maintaining and optimizing Workday FINS functional areas.
* Adaptive Planning experience a plus.
* Relevant Workday Certifications a plus.
* A combination of implementation and operational experience is preferred.


 We celebrate our differences and strive to create a workplace where each person can be their authentic self. We are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. Employees are encouraged to unleash their innovative, collaborative, and entrepreneurial spirits. With a holistic approach as an Equal Opportunity Employer, we provide a safe space where all employees feel empowered to succeed.

title: IT-arkitekt till kund inom offentlig sektor
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Just nu söker vi en IT-arkitekt till en av våra kunder inom offentlig sektor i Stockholm. Du kommer att bli en del av vårt härliga arkitekt-team på CGI där vi jobbar i nära samarbete med bland annat affärskonsulter, applikationsexperter, utvecklare och andra arkitekter.
   

  

 I uppdraget kommer du att vara en nyckelperson som bidrar till att aktivt driva och ta fram efterfrågat material så som lösningsförslag och icke-funktionella krav för att kunna ta viktiga beslut inom både arkitektur och teknik.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Förutom offentlig sektor arbetar vi brett inom olika branscher och kunder, vilket också ger möjlighet för dig att utveckla dig själv och din kompetens.
   

  

 I dina framtida arbetsuppgifter ingår bland annat lösningsförslag och säkerställande av robust it-arkitektur. Men också förstudier, roadmaps samt modellering, metodutveckling och integrationer. Jobbet som IT-arkitekt är både brett och tvärfunktionellt och du stöttar kunden i både lösningar och genomförande.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett härligt team konsulter med olika erfarenhetsnivå som alla delar ett brinnande intresse för arkitektur och lösningar. Vi gillar att samverka i en kreativ, positiv och energigivande miljö där samarbete, kontinuerligt lärande och att stötta varandra värderas högt i det dagliga arbetet.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* 5 års erfarenhet som IT-arkitekt
* En djup teknisk kunskap och ett intresse for kommande tekniker
* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT


 Det är meriterande om du har kännedom kring:
   

  

* Agila metoder
* Maskininlärning och AI
* Molnplattformar


 Det är även meriterande om du har någon certifiering från IASA eller liknande.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Javautvecklare inom Kundplattform och CRM till Handelsbanken
description:
*Vi söker nu erfaren Javautvecklare med plattform och integrationserfarenhet. Hos oss får du ny- och vidareutveckla Handelsbankens Kundplattform och CRM inom Salesforce.*
**Ditt team**
 Som utvecklare kommer du bli en del av plattform- och integrationsteamet som idag består av Java- och Salesforce utvecklare, Business Analyst, testare, Agil Product Owner och Team Coach. Tillsammans jobbar teamet för att leverera funktionalitet för att stödja Handelsbankens kundplattform och CRM baserat på Salesforce. Utöver teamet samarbetar du nära med utvecklare och arkitekter, inom och utanför vårt område. Vi har roligt på jobbet och vårt team präglas av hög kompetens och bred erfarenhet inom både teknik och affärsverksamhet.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Du kommer i samarbete med teamet att designa, utveckla och underhålla integrationslösningar mot bankens övriga system, som är nödvändiga för vår kundplattform. Du kommer också arbeta med att felsöka och lösa tekniska problem som uppstår i integrationsprocessen. Idag bygger vi våra integrationer i Java men vi kommer framåt nyttja integrationsmönster baserade på APIer, event och PaaS-tjänster som finns i Microsoft Azure.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Din roll**
 Vi söker dig som är erfaren Javautvecklare med stort intresse av att bygga integrationer. Du har erfarenhet av integrationsdesign och god förståelse för integrationsmönster. Du har kunskap inom verktygen JPA, JMS/MQ, Git och Maven. Vi ser också att du har arbetat med någon applikationsserver som exempelvis OpenLiberty. Vidare har du kunskap inom REST. Då vi samarbetar med hela koncernen, behöver du behärska både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift för att kunna kommunicera effektivt.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* integration med hjälp av Microsoft Azure
* integration av Salesforce
* relationsdatabaser
* Docker
* Kubernetes


 Som person arbetar du tillsammans med ditt team och tar vara på kollegors olika perspektiv för att nå uppsatta mål. Det kommer naturligt att tänka i nya banor för att komma till skalbara lösningar. Du skapar en helhetsbild genpm att inkludera olika perspektiv och där igenom att sätta detaljer i större sammanhang.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Vi erbjuder**
* en trygg och stabil arbetsgivare
* dynamiskt och stimulerande arbete
* work-life balance
* kompetens- och karriärutveckling
* inkluderande- och jämställd arbetsmiljö
* konkurrenskraftigt förmånspaket

title: Frontendutvecklare inom Rådgivning till Handelsbanken
description:
***Vi söker nu en Frontendutvecklare inom .Net som vill vidareutveckla Handelsbankens* 
 lösningar för rådgivning!**
**Ditt team**
 Du blir del av ett prestigelöst team med en Agile Product Owner, Team Coach, testare och fullstackutvecklare med kompetens inom React och .Net. Vi har roligt på jobbet och vårt team präglas av hög kompetens och bred erfarenhet inom både teknik och affärsverksamhet. Vårt fokus är att stärka bankens rådgivning och kundrelationer genom att säkerställa en konsekvent och kvalitativ upplevelse i alla kundmöten. Genom att utveckla och förvalta lösningar som stödjer rådgivare och förbättrar kunddialogen bidrar området direkt till bankens affärsmål och tillväxt. Inom teamet samarbetar vi tätt, hjälper varandra och gillar att lösa problem tillsammans.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som frontendutvecklare kommer du att använda din expertis för att vidareutveckla funktionaliteten i bankens rådgivningssystem med särskilt fokus på frontendutveckling med React och dess ekosystem. I rollen är du delaktig i arkitekturbeslut avseende frontend och säkerställer att våra applikationer håller en hög säkerhetsnivå samt bidrar i utvecklingen av backend vid behov. Du kommer också att arbeta med grafisk visualisering och anpassa gränssnitt för olika enheter. Ett nära samarbete med frontend- och backend-utvecklare samt UX/UI både inom teamet och organisationen är en viktig del av din vardag. Rollen ger dig möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och att ansvara för att vidareutveckla och förvalta det vi skapar i en bransch som ständigt förändras.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling inom React, JavaScript, HTML och CSS. Din tekniska bakgrund har givit dig erfarenhet av att arbeta operativt med programmering och att ta ett helhetsansvar för utvecklingsområdet inom din roll. Vidare har du erfarenhet av arkitektur- och designbeslut för frontendutveckling. Vi ser även att du har kunskap inom .Net och C#. Då vi samarbetar med hela koncernen, behöver du behärska både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift för att kunna kommunicera effektivt.
   

  

 Som person arbetar du tillsammans med ditt team och tar tillvara på kollegors olika perspektiv för att nå uppsatta mål. Det kommer naturligt att tänka i nya banor för att komma fram till skalbara lösningar. Då systemen är kritiska är det viktigt att du kan följa befintliga strukturer och processer, men även föreslå och skapa nya vid behov. Du skapar en helhetsbild genom att inkludera olika perspektiv och därigenom att sätta detaljer i ett större sammanhang.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* UI
* grafisk visualisering
* testautomatisering (Testcafé och Typescript)
* Salesforce


**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Vi erbjuder**
* en trygg och stabil arbetsgivare
* dynamiskt och stimulerande arbete
* work-life balance
* kompetens- och karriärutveckling
* inkluderande- och jämställd arbetsmiljö
